byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Hwaida Saad in Beirut, Lebanon, and Karam Shoumali in Istanbul.

abstract: Federation of Press Associations of Spain fear three Spanish journalists have been abducted after having gone missing for several days in Syria; Antonio Pampliega, Jose Manual Lopez and Angel Sastre disappeared while working in Aleppo and Syrians familiar with case say trio was seized by gunmen; incident comes amidst concerns that missing Japanese journalist Jumpei Yasuda was also kidnapped.
lead_paragraph: Reports of the disappearance of Antonio Pampliega, José Manuel López and Ángel Sastre come amid concern about a missing Japanese journalist, Jumpei Yasuda.

headline.main: 3 Spanish Journalists Missing in Syria and Feared Abducted
headline.print_headline: World Briefing | Middle East; Syria: Journalists Are Missing

snippet: Reports of the disappearance of Antonio Pampliega, José Manuel López and Ángel Sastre come amid concern about a missing Japanese journalist, Jumpei Yasuda.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
